title: Spaghetti Squash with Chilies, Lime and Dukkah

ingredients.content: 4 oz whole raw almonds, skin on
1 serrano chili, stem removed, plus extra to garnish
1 spaghetti squash (approx. 24-32 oz), cut in half and seeds removed
½ oz fresh cilantro, chopped (approx. 16 leaves and tender stems)

preparations.content: Place pistachios, almonds, sesame seeds, cumin and coriander into mixing bowl and without the measuring cup, toast <b>8 min/250°F//speed 1<b>.  Allow to cool for 10 minutes or until contents reach 140°F.
Add ¼ tsp salt and peppercorns and pulse <b>Turbo/2 sec/3-4 times<b>. Remove Dukkah from mixing bowl and set aside.
Place onion and chili into mixing bowl and chop <b>3 sec/speed 5<b>.  Add apple cider vinegar, sugar and water.

Place Varoma dish into position and place in spaghetti squash, flesh side down. Secure Varoma lid and steam <b>40 min/Varoma//speed 2<b> or until squash is cooked to your liking. Remove Varoma and Varoma lid and set spaghetti squash aside to cool. Drag a fork across flesh of spaghetti squash, pulling up the strands. Transfer spaghetti squash and onions into a large serving bowl.
Add cilantro, lime juice and ¼ tsp salt to spaghetti squash and stir through with spatula to combine. Sprinkle with reserved Dukkah, to taste. Can be served either hot or cold.

hintsAndTricks: Cut spaghetti squash into quarters if the Varoma lid does not fit flush with the Varoma dish. Check to make sure squash is done: for a softer texture steam for an additional 5 minutes.

For Dukkah with more texture, only pulse <b>1 sec/turbo<b>. Leftover Dukkah can be refrigerated in an airtight container for 2-4 months. Dukkah can also be stored in the freezer for 6 months where it stays crisp and does not absorb moisture.

Roast squash seeds and add to a trail mix; toss in salads or make a hearty granola with these nutritious seeds. Line a baking pan with parchment paper and set aside. Place a large bowl onto mixing bowl lid and add pumpkin seeds, 32 oz boiling water and 4 oz sea salt. Stir through until salt has dissolved and set aside to soak for 3 hours or overnight. Drain and pat dry with paper towels. Preheat oven to 350°F. Place 1 oz butter into mixing bowl and melt <b>4 min/160°F/speed 2<b>. Add pumpkin seeds and mix through butter <b>30 sec//<b>. Spread the seeds in a single layer on a baking sheet and bake for 45 minutes or until golden brown. Stir 2 times (approx. every 15 min.).
Replace apple cider vinegar with balsamic vinegar. Replace serrano pepper with Shishito or jalapeño.
